action.action-desc: Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York (for himself and Mr. Espaillat) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the United States Housing Act of 1937 to establish pass-through lease arrangements for uninhabitable dwelling units, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Affordable Housing Protection Act.

section.header: Pass-through lease arrangements for uninhabitable dwelling units
section.text: Section 8(c) of the United States Housing Act of 1937 (42 U.S.C. 1437f(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Any owner of a covered dwelling unit that was rendered uninhabitable shall, if approved by the Secretary, temporarily lease a habitable dwelling unit in another building for the covered resident for the period during which such unit is repaired.
The Secretary shall issue guidance establishing policies for a temporary lease arrangement described in subparagraph (A), which shall include—

clause.text: a description of the process and the length of time allowed for identifying a habitable dwelling unit in another building; and
procedures if such a habitable dwelling unit is not available.

subparagraph.text: The following conditions shall apply to a temporary lease arrangement described under subparagraph (A):

clause.text: The owner of a covered dwelling unit shall be responsible for ensuring that the owner of the unit temporarily leased receives monthly payments for rent.

A covered resident residing in a unit temporarily leased shall make monthly payments for rent to the owner of the covered dwelling unit such covered resident previously occupied. Such payments may not exceed the maximum monthly rent established pursuant to the assistance contract.

subparagraph.text: Upon completion of repairs to a covered dwelling unit that was rendered uninhabitable, the owner of such unit shall provide written notice to the covered resident that such unit is habitable and that the covered resident may choose to return to such unit. The owner may not offer such unit to another eligible applicant under this section unless—

clause.text: the covered resident chooses not to return to such unit; and
the owner terminates the temporary lease arrangement described in subparagraph (A).

subparagraph.text: This paragraph shall apply to the renewal of any assistance contract for project-based assistance under this section.

clause.text: The term covered dwelling unit means an existing dwelling unit that receives project-based assistance through an assistance contract under this section.
The term covered resident means a resident of a covered dwelling unit before such unit was rendered uninhabitable.

The term habitable dwelling unit means a dwelling unit for which a third party inspector approved by the Secretary, has determined meets housing quality standards established under section 6(f) or physical condition standards and physical inspection requirements under section 200.855 of title 24, Code of Federal Regulations.
